techmeme.title: TikTok is offering users hundreds of dollars in Shop credits to spend time in the app, invite friends to join, and purchase products, ahead of a possible US ban (Alexandra S. Levine/Bloomberg)
Microsoft AI CEO Mustafa Suleyman is building a new London-based team focused on health by poaching staff from a similar unit he once led at Google DeepMind (Madhumita Murgia/Financial Times)
Google's top lobbyist Mark Isakowitz departs to become GOP Senator-elect Dave McCormick's chief of staff, leaving a power vacuum in the company's lobbying team (Emily Birnbaum/Bloomberg)
Several Cruise employees say they were "surprised" and "blindsided" by GM's decision to end Cruise's robotaxi program and that they expect job cuts (TechCrunch)
Mozilla is removing the "Do Not Track" feature from Firefox in version 135, the first major browser to do so, saying few websites honor the preference (Venkat/Windows Report)
